intro: Notanthera longibracteatus, commonly known as the long-bract notanthera, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive bract structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Notanthera longibracteatus plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is valued for its ornamental appeal in xeriscaping.
